channel.title: NASA Breaking News
channel.description: A RSS news feed containing the latest NASA news articles and press releases.

item.title: NASA Administrator Bolden to Hail Success of Commercial Cargo Program
item.description: NASA Administrator Charles Bolden will discuss the success of the agency's Commercial Orbital Transportation Services (COTS) initiative during a televised news briefing at 11:30 a.m. EST Wednesday, Nov. 13.

item.title: Study Finds Climate Link to 'Atmospheric River' Storms
item.description: A new NASA-led study of "atmospheric river" storms from the Pacific Ocean may help scientists better predict major winter snowfalls that hit West Coast mountains and lead to heavy spring runoff and sometimes flooding.

item.title: NASA Sets MAVEN/Atlas V Launch Events Coverage
item.description: NASA's next Mars-bound spacecraft, the Mars Atmosphere and Volatile Evolution (MAVEN), is set to launch aboard a United Launch Alliance Atlas V 401 rocket Monday, Nov. 18.

item.title: NASA's Orion Sees Flawless Fairing Separation in Second Test
item.description: The three massive panels protecting a test version of NASA's Orion multipurpose crew vehicle successfully fell away from the spacecraft Wednesday in a test of a system that will protect Orion during its first trip to space next year.

item.title: NASA TV to Air Russian Spacewalk Featuring the Olympic Torch
item.description: Two Russian cosmonauts will carry the Olympic torch when they venture outside the International Space Station Saturday, Nov. 9, for a six-hour spacewalk to perform maintenance work on the orbiting laboratory.

item.title: NASA Opens Media Accreditation for December Orbital Sciences Cargo Resupply Mission to International Space Station
item.description: Media accreditation is open for the launch of the first contracted cargo resupply mission to the International Space Station from Virginia.

item.title: NASA's Hubble Sees Asteroid Spouting Six Comet-Like Tails
item.description: Astronomers viewing our solar system's asteroid belt with NASA's Hubble Space Telescope have seen for the first time an asteroid with six comet-like tails of dust radiating from it like spokes on a wheel.

item.title: New Crew Launches to Space Station with Olympic Torch Aboard
item.description: Three crew members representing the United States, Russia and Japan are on their way to the International Space Station after launching from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan at 11:14 p.m. EST Wednesday, 10:14 a.m. Nov. 7, Kazakh time.

item.title: NASA and International Researchers Obtain Crucial Data from Meteoroid Impact
item.description: A team of NASA and international scientists for the first time have gathered a detailed understanding of the effects on Earth from a small asteroid impact.

item.title: NASA, Bigelow Aerospace to Hold Media Availability
item.description: Representatives of NASA and Bigelow Aerospace will discuss the North Las Vegas, Nev., company's completed and upcoming projects for the agency in a media availability Tuesday, Nov. 12, in Washington.
